event.title: 2010, the center of population of Oklahoma was located

data.event: In 2010, the center of population of Oklahoma was located in Lincoln County, near the town of Sparks.

event.title: known as the Louisiana Purchase from France in 1803

data.event: The United States purchased the large tract of land known as the Louisiana Purchase from France in 1803.
The Osage hunted on land that includes present-day Lincoln County until they ceded the area in an 1825 treaty to the federal government.
After the Civil War in 1866, these tribes were forced to give up lands that included present-day Lincoln County in Reconstruction Treaties for siding with the Confederacy.
Established in 1870, the Sac and Fox agency, established on the eastern edge of the present-day county, was the first settlement in the area.
